alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 5:57AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. .Recent rainfall continues to lead to rises along the Red Lake River. Due to upstream trends in river rises, expecting a rapid rise into Moderate flood stage early Saturday, then Major flood stage by late Saturday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Lake River at Crookston. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Lowest level of uncertified levee system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM CDT Saturday was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
